reviewText:
Ghosts in a house is a serious business if they interrupted with a couple's intimacy and damaged young husband's reputation and career, especially.

The rest is a fun as producers explored social aspects of homosexuality and its application to a recent French environment.

This film (in French with clear English subtitles) is a fun way to spend a 'snowed in' evening in front of the TV. It's not challenging, it is rather tacky (but in a funny way) and is based on a novel idea - young couple buy run down house and he discovers it's 'possessed' by five poltergays from the 1970s. It's not scary (but then doesn't try to be) it is funny; albeit in a clichd way. It won't be everyone's cup of tea, but is an unchallenging way to wind down after a long day at work. (It took me a week to get 'Boney M's "Ra Ra Rasputin" out of my head - but every time I found myself humming it I was smiling at the memory of the movie - maybe That's Scary!!!).
It was okay.  I had hoped for more hotness.
Don't waste your time. Bad movie all way round... directing, acting, storyline....

Saw this at a fundraiser for Gay & Lesbian film festive & enjoyed this comedy, so I decided to purchase it.  Please note it is subtitled, so you really have to pay attention in order to tell what's going on.
fun if you like stupid and a return to the 70's ..... not much there but stupid time waster...

It is funny and original, but a big print warning:  It is French and the English subtitles are slightly off.  Why only 3 stars?  I thought the ending was flat and weak.  It was if the money had all been spent making the first 3/4 of the movie and they had only 30 minutes left to film the ending.
Pretty bad! So bad that is fun.
This movie was enjoyable, and funny.  It worth the time to have a laugh at a fish out of water story.
